meanings.sent1: Before the concert, the musician spent hours preattuning his guitar.
meanings.sent2: She always preattunes the radio to her favorite station before going to bed.
meanings.sent3: The robot thought it was preattuning itself to play music, but it ended up making strange noises instead.
meanings.sent4: His mind was preattuning itself to focus on the task at hand, like a finely tuned instrument.
meanings.sent5: The athlete preattuned her body to the rhythm of the race, ready to sprint at the sound of the starting gun.

meanings.definition: The act of tuning in advance.
meanings.sent1: The preattuning of the piano ensured that the performance would be flawless.
meanings.sent2: His preattuning of the equipment saved time during the setup process.
meanings.sent3: The preattuning of the TV channels made it easier to switch between programs quickly.
meanings.sent4: The preattuning of the engine made the car run smoothly on the race track.
meanings.sent5: The preattuning of the violin strings created a beautiful harmony when the musician played.
